intro: Rhynchospora subsetosa, commonly known as the narrowleaf spikerush, is a flowering plant belonging to the Cyperaceae family. It is characterized by its tall, grass-like appearance with slender, ribbed stems and spike-like inflorescences. The plant typically grows in wetland habitats such as marshes, swamps, and along the edges of ponds. Its flowers are small and clustered, with three stamens and a three-lobed pistil. Rhynchospora subsetosa plays an important ecological role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for various aquatic and terrestrial organisms.
